A psalm that expresses sadness, written for the choir director by Zerah’s son Heman, one of the descendants of Korah
Yahweh God, you who rescues me, all during each day I call out
and I cry out to you during each night also.
while I cry out to you
and I am about to die [MTY] and go where dead people are.
Because I have no more strength,
consider that I will soon die.
I am like a corpse that has been abandoned;
I am like dead people who lie in their graves,
people who have been completely forgotten,
because you do not take care of them any more.
you have thrown me into a deep, dark pit,
into a place where they throw corpses.
you are very angry with me,
You have caused my friends to ◄avoid/stay away from► me;
I have become repulsive to them.
I am in a prison and cannot escape.
My eyes cannot see well because I cry very much.
Yahweh, every day I call out to you
I lift up my hands to you
You certainly do not [RHQ] perform miracles for dead people!
Their spirits do not [RHQ] arise to praise you!
Corpses in the grave certainly do not tell about your faithfully loving us [RHQ],
and in the place where people are finally destroyed,
no one tells about what you faithfully
No one in the deep dark pit ever sees the miracles that you perform [RHQ],
and no one in the place where people have been completely forgotten tells about your being good to us.
, Yahweh, I cry out to you
each morning I pray to you.
Yahweh, why do you reject me [RHQ]?
Why do you turn away from me [RHQ]?
All the time since I was young, I have suffered and have often almost died;
I am ◄in despair/very discouraged► because of enduring the terrible things that you have done to me.
you have crushed me because of your being angry with me;
the terrible things that you are doing to me are almost destroying me.
they surround me like a flood [SIM];

my friends and others whom I love to avoid me,
